intro: Cyrtochilum orgyale, commonly known as the Himalayan orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers with a distinctive coloration, often in shades of white and purple. Cyrtochilum orgyale thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing on rock surfaces or in shaded forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
